ChatGPT said:
This data provides a breakdown of college basketball betting results based on the closing point spread and over/under totals. Here are a few key takeaways from the data:

1. Betting on Favorites vs. Underdogs
When the spread is large (14+), underdogs cover more often than favorites:

0-125.5 total points: Dogs cover 53.6%

126-130.5 total points: Dogs cover 54.3%

131-135.5 total points: Dogs cover 52.6%

When the spread is moderate (3-9.5 points), the results are nearly 50/50, with a slight edge toward underdogs.

2. Over/Under Trends
Games with very low totals (0-125.5) tend to hit the over slightly more often (e.g., 51.1% for a 7-9.5 point spread).

High-scoring games (151+ total points) tend to go under more often:

For 7-9.5 point spreads: Under 51.9%

For 1-2.5 point spreads: Under 51.0%

For 10-13.5 point spreads: Under 51.6%

3. Small Spreads & Totals
When spreads are small (1-2.5 points), underdogs cover 49.2%-51.2% of the time, showing no clear advantage.

Overs tend to hit slightly more often when totals are low (e.g., 53.7% over rate when total is 126-130.5).

Potential Betting Strategies
Fade big favorites (14+): Underdogs have historically covered at 52-54%.

Bet unders in high-total games (151+): The under has hit at 51.6%+ in most cases.

Lean toward overs in low-total games (126-130.5): The over has cashed around 53.7% of the time when spreads are small.
